content.transcript:
Why is cleaning important?

Cleaning is important for several reasons. It minimizes the risk of food contamination, food poisoning and spoilage by:
  • Removing matter on which bacteria would grow and enabling the effective disinfection of equipment and surfaces;
  • Removing materials that would encourage pest infestations;
  • Removing dirt and grease; and
  • Reducing the risk of foreign matter contamination.

    • Cleaning also ensures a pleasant and safe working environment and promotes a favourable image to customers. By law businesses must ensure that food is fit for human consumption. To meet these requirements cleaning will be needed at some point.

    While cleaning you must use hot water, detergent and physical energy to effectively remove dirt and grease.

    Always 'Clear-and-clean-as-you-go' to efficiently maintain cleanliness.

    Keep work areas clean and tidy; don't let waste food and dirty equipment build up.

    Remove spillages and waste packaging immediately.
